channel.title: Comments on: Cycle Detection in F# – Fun With Immutability
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description:
Hmm guess notifications weren't working for a while.
Should be fun to see where the problem lies, I haven't really done much with F# since 2011. At least it got me the right answer for project euler tho? ;)
item.content:encoded:
Hmm guess notifications weren’t working for a while.

Should be fun to see where the problem lies, I haven’t really done much with F# since 2011. At least it got me the right answer for project euler tho? ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Daniel Fabian (@iceypoi)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Fabian (@iceypoi)
item.description: Dear Alex, sorry for the necro, but I just stumbled upon your post and used the code. Turns out, that your functional solution is incorrect, the mu is always 0, because you start off at tortoise and hare, as opposed to x.
item.content:encoded: Dear Alex, sorry for the necro, but I just stumbled upon your post and used the code. Turns out, that your functional solution is incorrect, the mu is always 0, because you start off at tortoise and hare, as opposed to x.

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.content:encoded:
Eh, you’re mostly right but he’s a bit too hard on himself at times ðŸ™‚

Denis, it does look strange at first but after a little while it starts to read quite well. It’s definitely worth playing around with a bit, especially if you’ve liked all the stuff linq makes possible in .net 3.5 and up.

item.title: By: chaospandion
item.dc:creator: chaospandion
item.description: That <em>"Matt"</em> fellow sounds like a complete moron.
item.content:encoded: That “Matt” fellow sounds like a complete moron.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Looks really cool, when I look at F# I am thinking I am looking at a foreign programming language so to speak
item.content:encoded: Looks really cool, when I look at F# I am thinking I am looking at a foreign programming language so to speak
